001package imagingbook.calibration.zhang;
002
003import imagingbook.calibration.zhang.util.MathUtil;
004import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
005import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.CholeskyDecomposition;
006import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
007import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
008
009/**
010 * This class defines methods for estimating the intrinsic camera parameters from multiple homographies. Alternative
011 * versions are provided (only one is actually used though).
012 *
013 * @author WB
014 */
015public class CameraIntrinsicsEstimator {
016
017        /**
018         * Version 1 (Zhang's original closed form solution). Estimates the the intrinsic camera parameters from multiple
019         * homographies.
020         *
021         * @param homographies a set of homography matrices
022         * @return the estimated 3 x 3 intrinsic transformation matrix
023         */
024        protected RealMatrix getCameraIntrinsicsZhang1(RealMatrix[] homographies) {
025                final int M = homographies.length;
026                int rows = 2 * M;
027                double[][] V = new double[rows][];
028
029                for (int i = 0; i < M; i++) {
030                        RealMatrix H = homographies[i];
031                        V[2*i] = getVpq(H, 0, 1); // v01
032                        V[2*i + 1] = Matrix.subtract(getVpq(H, 0, 0), getVpq(H, 1, 1)); // v00-v11
033                }
034
035                if (M == 2) {
036                        V[V.length - 1] = new double[] { 0, 1, 0, 0, 0, 0 };
037                }
038                
039                RealMatrix VM = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(V);
040//              MathUtil.print("estimateIntrinsics: V = ", VM);//WB
041                
042                double[] b = MathUtil.solveHomogeneousSystem(VM).toArray();     // solve VM.b=0
043                
044                final double vc         = (b[1] * b[3] - b[0] * b[4]) / (b[0] * b[2] - b[1] * b[1]);
045                final double lambda = b[5] - (b[3] * b[3] + vc * (b[1] * b[3] - b[0] * b[4])) / b[0];
046                final double alpha      = Math.sqrt(lambda / b[0]);
047                final double beta       = Math.sqrt(lambda * b[0] / (b[0] * b[2] - b[1] * b[1]));
048                final double gamma      = -b[1] * alpha * alpha * beta / lambda;
049                final double uc         = gamma * vc / alpha - b[3] * alpha * alpha / lambda;   // PAMI paper = WRONG!
050
051                RealMatrix A = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(new double[][] {
052                                { alpha, gamma, uc },
053                                { 0, beta, vc },
054                                { 0, 0, 1 }
055                });
056
057                return A;
058        }
059
060        /**
061         * Version 2 (Zhang's corrected closed form solution). Estimates the the intrinsic camera parameters from multiple
062         * homographies.
063         *
064         * @param homographies a set of homography matrices
065         * @return the estimated 3 x 3 intrinsic transformation matrix
066         */
067        protected RealMatrix getCameraIntrinsicsZhang2(RealMatrix[] homographies) {
068                final int M = homographies.length;
069                int rows = 2 * M;
070                double[][] V = new double[rows][];
071
072                for (int i = 0; i < M; i++) {
073                        RealMatrix H = homographies[i];
074                        V[2*i] = getVpq(H, 0, 1); // v01
075                        V[2*i + 1] = Matrix.subtract(getVpq(H, 0, 0), getVpq(H, 1, 1)); // v00-v11
076                }
077
078                if (M == 2) {
079                        V[V.length - 1] = new double[] { 0, 1, 0, 0, 0, 0 };
080                }
081                
082                RealMatrix VM = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(V);
083                double[] b = MathUtil.solveHomogeneousSystem(VM).toArray();     // solve VM.b=0
084                
085                final double vc         = (b[1] * b[3] - b[0] * b[4]) / (b[0] * b[2] - b[1] * b[1]);
086                final double lambda = b[5] - (b[3] * b[3] + vc * (b[1] * b[3] - b[0] * b[4])) / b[0];
087                final double alpha      = Math.sqrt(lambda / b[0]);
088                final double beta       = Math.sqrt(lambda * b[0] / (b[0] * b[2] - b[1] * b[1]));
089                final double gamma      = -b[1] * alpha * alpha * beta / lambda;
090                final double uc         = gamma * vc / beta - b[3] * alpha * alpha / lambda;    // beta! 1998 report seems correct!
091
092                RealMatrix A = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(new double[][] {
093                                { alpha, gamma, uc },
094                                { 0, beta, vc },
095                                { 0, 0, 1 }
096                });
097
098                return A;
099        }
100
101        /**
102         * Version 3 (WB's closed form solution). Estimates the the intrinsic camera parameters from multiple homographies.
103         *
104         * @param homographies a set of homography matrices
105         * @return the estimated 3 x 3 intrinsic transformation matrix
106         */
107        protected RealMatrix getCameraIntrinsicsZhang3(RealMatrix[] homographies) {
108                final int M = homographies.length;
109                int rows = 2 * M;
110                double[][] V = new double[rows][];
111
112                for (int i = 0; i < M; i++) {
113                        RealMatrix H = homographies[i];
114                        V[2*i] = getVpq(H, 0, 1); // v01
115                        V[2*i + 1] = Matrix.subtract(getVpq(H, 0, 0), getVpq(H, 1, 1)); // v00-v11
116                }
117
118                if (M == 2) {
119                        V[V.length - 1] = new double[] { 0, 1, 0, 0, 0, 0 };
120                }
121                
122                RealMatrix VM = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(V);
123                double[] b = MathUtil.solveHomogeneousSystem(VM).toArray();     // solve VM.b=0
124                
125                final double w = b[0]*b[2]*b[5] - b[1]*b[1]*b[5] - b[0]*b[4]*b[4] + 2*b[1]*b[3]*b[4] - b[2]*b[3]*b[3];
126                final double d = 
127                                b[0] * b[2] - b[1] * b[1];
128                final double uc = 
129                                (b[1] * b[4] - b[2] * b[3]) / d;
130                final double vc = 
131                                (b[1] * b[3] - b[0] * b[4]) / d;
132                final double alpha      = 
133                                Math.sqrt(w / (d * b[0]));
134                final double beta       = 
135                                Math.sqrt(w / (d * d) * b[0]);
136                final double gamma      = 
137                                  Math.sqrt(w / (d * d * b[0])) * b[1];
138                
139                RealMatrix A = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(new double[][] {
140                                { alpha, gamma, uc },
141                                { 0, beta, vc },
142                                { 0, 0, 1 }
143                });
144
145                return A;
146        }
147
148
149        /**
150         * Final version by WB (this version is used by default). Estimates the intrinsic camera parameters from multiple
151         * homographies using a Cholesky decomposition.
152         *
153         * @param homographies a set of homography matrices
154         * @return the estimated 3 x 3 intrinsic transformation matrix
155         */
156        protected RealMatrix getCameraIntrinsics(RealMatrix[] homographies) {
157                final int M = homographies.length;
158                int rows = 2 * M;
159                double[][] V = new double[rows][];
160
161                for (int i = 0; i < M; i++) {
162                        RealMatrix H = homographies[i];
163                        V[2*i] = getVpq(H, 0, 1); // v01
164                        V[2*i + 1] = Matrix.subtract(getVpq(H, 0, 0), getVpq(H, 1, 1)); // v00-v11
165                }
166
167                if (M == 2) {
168                        V[V.length - 1] = new double[] { 0, 1, 0, 0, 0, 0 };
169                }
170                
171                RealMatrix VM = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(V);
172//              MathUtil.print("estimateIntrinsics: V = ", VM);//WB
173                
174                double[] b = MathUtil.solveHomogeneousSystem(VM).toArray();     // solve VM.b=0
175                
176                RealMatrix B = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(new double[][]
177                                {{b[0], b[1], b[3]},
178                                 {b[1], b[2], b[4]},
179                                 {b[3], b[4], b[5]}});
180                
181                if (B.getEntry(0, 0) < 0 || B.getEntry(1, 1) < 0 || B.getEntry(2, 2) < 0) {     
182                        B = B.scalarMultiply(-1);       // make sure B is positive definite 
183                }
184                
185                CholeskyDecomposition cd = new CholeskyDecomposition(B);
186                RealMatrix L = cd.getL();
187                RealMatrix A = MatrixUtils.inverse(L).transpose().scalarMultiply(L.getEntry(2, 2));
188                return A;
189        }
190
191//      private double[] getVpq(RealMatrix H, int p, int q) {
192//              H = H.transpose();
193//              final double[] vij = new double[] {
194//                              H.getEntry(p, 0) * H.getEntry(q, 0),
195//                              H.getEntry(p, 0) * H.getEntry(q, 1) + H.getEntry(p, 1) * H.getEntry(q, 0),
196//                              H.getEntry(p, 1) * H.getEntry(q, 1),
197//                              H.getEntry(p, 2) * H.getEntry(q, 0) + H.getEntry(p, 0) * H.getEntry(q, 2),
198//                              H.getEntry(p, 2) * H.getEntry(q, 1) + H.getEntry(p, 1) * H.getEntry(q, 2),
199//                              H.getEntry(p, 2) * H.getEntry(q, 2)
200//              };
201//              return vij;
202//      }
203        
204        // version without transpose
205        private double[] getVpq(RealMatrix H, int p, int q) {
206                final double[] vpq = new double[] {
207                                H.getEntry(0, p) * H.getEntry(0, q),
208                                H.getEntry(0, p) * H.getEntry(1, q) + H.getEntry(1, p) * H.getEntry(0, q),
209                                H.getEntry(1, p) * H.getEntry(1, q),
210                                H.getEntry(2, p) * H.getEntry(0, q) + H.getEntry(0, p) * H.getEntry(2, q),
211                                H.getEntry(2, p) * H.getEntry(1, q) + H.getEntry(1, p) * H.getEntry(2, q),
212                                H.getEntry(2, p) * H.getEntry(2, q)
213                };
214                return vpq;
215        }
216
217}
